author: wsjcom
title: Pricing and the USPS-Amazon Relationship
text: Regarding your editorial “Trump, Amazon and the Post Office” (April 3): Since when is the price of a service determined by the incremental cost to the service provider, as opposed to the value of the service to the recipient? At Starbucks, a grande latte costs about $4 because the market will bear that price. I don’t get a lower-priced beverage at Starbucks because by the time I arrive at the store the lease has already been signed, the employees have already been hired and the coffee has already been made. Nobody would accept this faulty logic. If I pay only 25 cents for my grande latte, this is not a boon for Starbucks...
